result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R French was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall not be in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Resolution reached; counsel free to argue Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Reading of Information waived.

Arraignment at 01-20-2016 09:45 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Counsel requests a January date for anticipated resolution.  DA to prepare an OTP.  Arraignment scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Atty Wilfred P. de Junco appearing for Def.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Defendant was moved from Kenosha County to Dodge Correctional.  DA to prepare an OTP.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety; Not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription; Defendant refused to sign bond
Def appeared by OTP; WCSD called; AWI 7/10/15

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $2,500 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with counsel.  Court will notify SPD to meet with Defendant before he is taken back to Kenosha County.  Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
